title: A Number of Fonts
content:
1) The font used for the quote on this page:  
 [http://www.barackobama.com/issues/iraq/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220142615/http:/www.barackobama.com/issues/iraq/ "http://www.barackobama.com/issues/iraq/")

2) The font used in this image, from the Cloverfield teaser trailer:  
 [http://img301.imageshack.us/img301/1292/picture3my7.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220142615/http:/img301.imageshack.us/img301/1292/picture3my7.png "http://img301.imageshack.us/img301/1292/picture3my7.png")

3) The font used on this PDF. I’m not sure if it’s the same as number 1:  
 [http://img201.imageshack.us/img201/4971/picture4lx9.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220142615/http:/img201.imageshack.us/img201/4971/picture4lx9.png "http://img201.imageshack.us/img201/4971/picture4lx9.png")

4) The font used for people’s posts on this board. Is it Times new roman? It looks different to me - softer.

5) The font used on the main-page of this website and I think is the same one used to tell name of thread above this post:  
 [http://img180.imageshack.us/img180/8216/picture5ie0.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220142615/http:/img180.imageshack.us/img180/8216/picture5ie0.png "http://img180.imageshack.us/img180/8216/picture5ie0.png")

Thank you so much in advance.

Adam.

 [‹ Logo book - body font ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220142615/http:/typophile.com/node/42163 "Go to previous forum topic") [Arnell Group wide sans caps ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220142615/http:/typophile.com/node/39612 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Rosenrot

comments.content:
4) It’s called _Georgia_, one of the screen-optimised Windows fonts you get with the OS or with a MS application like Office, that’s why Mac-Folks can see that also.

\>3) The font used on this PDF.  
Download the PDF, check File/Properties/Fonts, normally you get there all infos about the embedded fonts.
5) Featured font is always to the right of the thread. Currently it’s FF Clan Pro.
Thank you for your quick response, helped greatly so far.
